text: Where did you take this screenshot from <@UBT0AHWLD>?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags/dnd-areas>
:grinning:
i am sorry i haven´t got the time to try the padding variable
no problem I'll just add a section with these settings to the template - then this can be copied and used as needed - it's the lightest touch approach possible.
i agree
Hmmmm have you tried modifying the template and then staging a cloned page in content staging? That might do the trick.

I’m switching from drag and drop templates to coded templates with DND_areas so I can’t used existing content.  I’ve already staged the page I’m working on and selected the new template and entered the appropriate content.  If I delete that or restage that I will have to enter all the content over again and I’d like to avoid that.  I’m wondering why vertical alignment isn’t something I can set in the style tab (or somewhere), being as the other settings you can assign to columns in the dnd_area partial like padding etc are all available for modification in the template itself.

I’m running into a bug with the editor that breaks changes made from dragging and dropping after the page is “previewed”. It looks as intended in the editor. Looks fine after saving. But after clicking preview it appears broken in both the editor and in the preview. Can someone from HubSpot please take a look at the page?

It’s based on a coded template that defaults to a 3 column layout, while in the editor we change it to a 4 column layout, but the new column seems to either appear in a separate row or is somehow misaligned after the “preview” (but can be setup properly in the editor)
cc <@ULCSUPTGU>
<@UCV0BC2A3> can you take a look?
Hi <@U017U9BRUPP> can you confirm which list you are referring to?
<@ULCSUPTGU> "select template" list on the old pages to the new template with a new DND Area
specifically on website pages settings tab under advanced

Thank you for confirming. Template swap as it exists today doesn't support swapping from the old dnd pages to coded files with dnd areas. However we just opened a beta for an update to this tool that does allow it. If you are interested I'm happy to add this tool to your account. I will note that it is still early on so there is plenty of room for improvement.
Hey Andrey - do you have a link to the page so I can poke around in it?
<@ULCSUPTGU> that really really would be helpful :slightly_smiling_face:
Plus, I'm from a QA background so beta's are my thing :wink:
Great! I'll DM you.
Sent link via direct message. Thank you
